title: Overflow error when trying to round trip negative i32 through byte string
body:
I am trying to convert an i32 to a bit_string using `format`, provide some manipulation, and then use `from_str_radix` to get the updated integer. However, when the string passed to `from_str_radix` is negative, I instead get an overflow error. Below is a simple example, where I don't manipulate the string at all. This error can also be seen by trying to set any variable using a binary literal e.g. `int val: i32 = 0b11111111111111111111111111111111`. I think that this may be related to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/53628. For now I have used the work around of converting the string to `u32` and then converting it to `i32` using the `ne_bytes` functions: ` i32::from_ne_bytes(val_from_bitstr.to_ne_bytes());` I tried this code: ```rust fn i32_round_trip(val: i32) { println!("Input: {}, {:032b}", val, val); let val_bitstr = format!("{:032b}", val); println!("val_bitstr: {}", val_bitstr); let val_from_bitstr = i32::from_str_radix(&val_bitstr, 2).unwrap(); println!("val_from_bitstr: {}", val_from_bitstr); } fn main() { i32_round_trip(-1); } ``` I expected to see this happen: *I expected the value in `val_from_bitstr` to return -1 in the second function call.* Instead, this happened: *Overflow error on the i32* ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.45.2 (d3fb005a3 2020-07-31) binary: rustc commit-hash: d3fb005a39e62501b8b0b356166e515ae24e2e54 commit-date: 2020-07-31 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.45.2 LLVM version: 10.0 ```
